evidence.pdf_reference: Solar-energy-driven CO 2 conversion into value-added chemical fuels holds great potential renewable energy generation.However, most of the photocatalysts facilitate a two-electron reduction process producing CO, hard for the eight-electron CH 4 production pathways which can stockpile more solar energy for further utilization.Herein, we developed an in situ assembly strategy to fabricate the lead-free perovskite Cs 2 AgBiBr 6 g-C 3 N 4 Zscheme system in toluene and the Cs 2 AgBiBr 6 g-C 3 N 4 type-II

stability (four consecutive photocatalytic cycles in solvent methanol as sacrificial reagent without obvious decrease of efficiency) and the mechanism (the prominent activity and the high CH 4 production selectivity boosted by Z-scheme system) were demonstrated.In this work, the first report for constructing lead-free halide perovskite Z-scheme and type-II photocatalytic systems for the regulation products selectivity of CO 2 reduction reaction provides a promising strategy for the fabrication other types

CH 2 Cl 2 . Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction reaction was carried out in a schlenk glass bottle (25 mL) at room temperature (the reaction temperature was controlled by a water bath).15 mg of CABBC 3 N 4 was added into the schlenk bottle as the photocatalyst.4 mL of ethyl acetate and 1 mL of methanol were injected into the reaction system as the solvent and sacrificial reagent, respectively.The static reaction system was degassed to remove O 2 and other gases before the reaction.When the 1.2 atm pure CO 2 was

Cs 2 AgBiBr 6 g-C 3 N 4 type-II heterojunction structure in CH 2 Cl 2 .By combining the reducing ability of the conduction band of g-C 3 N 4 and the oxidizing ability of the valence band of Cs 2 AgBiBr 6 perovskite, this Z-scheme system exhibits superior CH 4 production in photocatalytic CO 2 reduction, in contrast to the high CO selectivity for the heterojunction photocatalysts, which is 10-fold and 16-fold higher than that of pure g-C 3 N 4 and pure CABB, respectively.The stability (four consecutive

The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

evidence.pdf_reference: the 1.2 atm pure CO 2 was refilled in the bottle though vacuum line under the condition of frozen solvent, the reaction start.The irradiation was conducted with a xenon lamp equipped to simulate the solar light illumination and the light intensity was adjusted to 150 mW cm -2 and the single-wavelength activity experiments were performed with a xenon lamp (light intensity of 80 mW cm -2 ) under monochromatic beams (435475 and 550 nm).The collected gaseous products were detected by gas chromatograph

spectra were carried out using a micro Raman imaging spectrometer DXRxi with an excitation of 532 nm laser light.Photoluminescence spectra were characterized by RF6000 spectro fluorophotometer (shimadzu, Japan) with a maximum excitation wavelength of 450 nm and a scanning wavelength range of 470-820 nm.The thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) was measured on Q600 SDT under N 2 protection with heating rate of 10 Cmin and the temperature range was from 30 C to 800 C.The surface photovaltage was measured by a

of 40 kV and the 2 was from 10to 80.The Ultraviolet-visible absorption spectroscopy was recorded on a Hitachi U-4100 UV-vis-NIR spectrophotometer equipped with an integrating sphere operating in reflection mode, using BaSO 4 as the reference sample.Fourier transform infrared spectra (FT-IR) were performed on Bruker VERTEX-70 spectrometer with a resolution of 1 cm -1 .X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) spectrums were obtained on an Axis Ultra with a monochromatic Al anode.Raman spectra were carried out

Solar-energy-driven CO 2 conversion into value-added chemical fuels holds great potential renewable energy generation.However, most of the photocatalysts facilitate a two-electron reduction process producing CO, hard for the eight-electron CH 4 production pathways which can stockpile more solar energy for further utilization.Herein, we developed an in situ assembly strategy to fabricate the lead-free perovskite Cs 2 AgBiBr 6 g-C 3 N 4 Zscheme system in toluene and the Cs 2 AgBiBr 6 g-C 3 N 4 type-II

photovaltage was measured by a made-up instrument.The photocurrents were measured on an CHI 660A electrochemical workstation with three electrode system (counter electrode: platinum sheet; reference electrode: AgAgCl in saturated KCl) and the working electrode was fabricated by drop casting 7 mg of CABB, g-C 3 N 4 , CABBC 3 N 4 -10 and CABBC 3 N 4 -82 on FTO with size of approximately 1 cm 2 .The electrolyte was 0.1 M 1-butyl-3-methylimidazolium hexafluorophosphate in CH 2 Cl 2 . Solar-energy-driven CO 2 conversion into value-added chemical fuels holds great potential renewable energy generation.However, most of the photocatalysts facilitate a two-electron reduction process producing CO, hard for the eight-electron CH 4 production pathways which can stockpile more solar energy for further utilization.Herein, we developed an in situ assembly strategy to fabricate the lead-free perovskite Cs 2 AgBiBr 6 g-C 3 N 4 Zscheme system in toluene and the Cs 2 AgBiBr 6 g-C 3 N 4 type-II

CH 2 Cl 2 . Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction reaction was carried out in a schlenk glass bottle (25 mL) at room temperature (the reaction temperature was controlled by a water bath).15 mg of CABBC 3 N 4 was added into the schlenk bottle as the photocatalyst.4 mL of ethyl acetate and 1 mL of methanol were injected into the reaction system as the solvent and sacrificial reagent, respectively.The static reaction system was degassed to remove O 2 and other gases before the reaction.When the 1.2 atm pure CO 2 was

photovaltage was measured by a made-up instrument.The photocurrents were measured on an CHI 660A electrochemical workstation with three electrode system (counter electrode: platinum sheet; reference electrode: AgAgCl in saturated KCl) and the working electrode was fabricated by drop casting 7 mg of CABB, g-C 3 N 4 , CABBC 3 N 4 -10 and CABBC 3 N 4 -82 on FTO with size of approximately 1 cm 2 .The electrolyte was 0.1 M 1-butyl-3-methylimidazolium hexafluorophosphate in CH 2 Cl 2 . system coupled with methanol as sacrificial agent under AM 1.5 G simulate solar irradiation.Fig. 2 displays the photocatalytic CO 2 conversion performance of four kinds of the photocatalysts.Similar to the previous literatures 39, two electron CO reduction processes are more likely to occur on CABB owing to their insufficient reduction potential, in contrast to eightelectron CH 4 production pathway for pure g-C 3 N 4 .After loading of g-C 3 N 4 on CABB, the composited photocatalysts exhibit superior CO 2
